books.description: A novel set in the fictional town of Maycomb, Alabama, during the Great Depression, and explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and its leader Big Brother, where individualism and independent thinking are suppressed.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to reclaim a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the Jazz Age of the 1920s, revolving around the enigmatic millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: An epic adventure novel about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge on the white whale Moby Dick, which destroyed his previous ship and severed his leg.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A gothic novel about the doomed love between Catherine Earnshaw and the brooding Heathcliff, set on the Yorkshire moors.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Márquez
books.description: A novel spanning seven generations of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending magical elements with political and historical events.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager who wanders through New York City after being expelled from prep school.

books.title: Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.description: An allegorical novel about a group of British boys stranded on a deserted island, who descend into savagery and chaos as they attempt to govern themselves.

books.author: Scott Peck
books.description: A self-help book exploring the idea that spiritual growth and fulfillment are achieved through accepting responsibility and confronting problems.

books.author: Kathryn Stockett
books.description: A novel set in 1960s Mississippi, which explores the lives of African American maids working in white households.

books.title: The Hunger Games
books.author: Suzanne Collins
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a post-apocalyptic nation called Panem, where teenagers are forced to participate in a televised death match called the Hunger Games.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.description: A realist novel set during the Great Depression, which follows the Joad family as they migrate from Oklahoma to California in search of a better life.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: An adventure novel narrated by Huck Finn, a young boy who escapes from his abusive father and embarks on a journey down the Mississippi River with Jim, a runaway slave.

books.title: The Scarlet Letter
books.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
books.description: A romance novel set in 17th century Puritan New England, which explores themes of sin, guilt, and redemption through the story of Hester Prynne, who is forced to wear a scarlet letter 'A' as punishment for adultery.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found, and follows one fireman named Guy Montag who rebels against the system.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a future totalitarian society where women are subjugated and used for reproductive purposes.

books.title: The Stranger
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: A philosophical novel about a detached and emotionally indifferent Algerian man named Meursault, who becomes embroiled in a murder case.

books.description: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr. John Watson, solving various mysteries in Victorian London.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A science fiction comedy novel following the misadventures of Arthur Dent after Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

books.title: The Sun Also Rises
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.description: A modernist novel set in the 1920s, following a group of American and British expatriates as they travel from Paris to Pamplona, Spain, to watch the running of the bulls.

books.title: The Old Man and the Sea
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.description: A novella about an aging Cuban fisherman named Santiago who embarks on a journey to catch a giant marlin, testing his strength and endurance against the forces of nature.

books.title: The Sound and the Fury
books.author: William Faulkner
books.description: A modernist novel exploring themes of memory, time, and decay through the fragmented narrative of the Compson family in Mississippi.
